data.title: When Google CEO Sundar Pichai took over Alphabet, he received more than a quarter-billion dollars
data.text: When Sundar Pichai was named the chief executive of Alphabet Inc.’s main division, Google, he received compensation of nearly $200 million, most of it in vesting stock awards.

data.title: Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth charts where Big Tech is headed
data.text: Carter Worth, Cornerstone Macro, on where the charts are pointing for Big Tech.

data.title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai made $280.6 million in 2019: proxy statement
data.text: Sundar Pichai, chief executive of Google parent Alphabet Inc. GOOGL, +0.42% GOOG, +0.23% , made $280.6 million in compensation in 2019, including $276.6 million in stock compensation, according to a proxy statement filed by the company Friday.

data.title: Big Tech reports next week, here's what to watch for
data.text: Getting ready for next week's Big Tech earnings.

data.title: Apple and Google are tweaking plans for tech to help officials track coronavirus exposure
data.text: Apple and Google still plan to release APIs to let governments use signals picked up from smartphones to alert people who may have been exposed to someone infected with Covid-19. On Friday, they announced some privacy tweaks and other changes.

data.title: Google, Apple adjust coronavirus tracking app to get ahead of privacy concerns
data.text: The tech giants are adding new security settings for their iPhone and Android phone technology.

data.title: Google Gears Up to Slash Marketing Budgets In Second Half
data.text: Google will still spend marketing dollars in certain business areas including digital.

data.title: Apple, Google update coronavirus contact tracing tech ahead of launch
data.text: Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google on Friday updated technical details of the coronavirus contact tracing system they plan to release next month, saying new features would strengthen privacy protections and give health authorities more detailed data.

data.title: Apple and Google update joint coronavirus tracing tech to improve user privacy and developer flexibility
data.text: Apple and Google have provided a number of updates about the technical details of their joint contact tracing system, which they’re now exclusively referring to as an “exposure notification” technology, since the companies say this is a better way to describe what they’re offering. The system is just one part of a contact tracing system, […]

data.title: Productivity In Times Of Quarantine: Alphabet To Report Q1 Results
data.text: Over the last month, we’ve seen how COVID-19 turned “life as we know it” a bit on its head.

data.title: Ireland should consider forcing Google, Facebook to pay media for content: PM
data.text: The Irish government should consider copying Australia's plan to force Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google to share advertising revenue with local media, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday.

data.title: What's in the Offing for Alphabet's (GOOGL) Q1 Earnings?
data.text: Alphabet's (GOOGL) focus on search, cloud and Waymo is likely to have aided first-quarter earnings. However, higher expenses and litigation charges might have been headwinds.

data.title: Google Announces Further Hiring And Marketing Budget Cuts
data.text: Alphabet Inc's (NASDAQ: GOOG) Google announced Thursday plans to halt hiring and cut down marketing budgets in non-essential businesses in the second half of 2020.

data.title: Alphabet vs. Microsoft: You Won’t Believe This!
data.text: Microsoft’s stock is up by over 100% since the beginning of 2018. But Google’s parent Alphabet’s stock is up a meager 22% during the same period.

data.title: Surprise! Most FAANG Stocks Are Historically Cheap
data.text: For Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, and Google (now a subsidiary of Alphabet), cash flow tells an interesting tale.

data.title: Google to slash marketing budgets by 50% and freeze hiring
data.text: Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL) said on Thursday that it will be cutting its Q2 marketing budgets by 50%. The company announced it to the marketing employees in an email that also highlighted that new recruitment of contract or full-time employees is paused until further notice.

data.title: Better Buy: Facebook vs. Alphabet
data.text: Both companies thrive off advertising, but is there a future beyond ads? Find out which has the superior growth strategy.

data.title: Technology's 'Big 5' Report Next Week - 20% Of S&P 500 Market Cap
data.text: Regardless of their sector label, most readers view these companies as "Tech" and they comprise an enormous amount of the S&P 500 market cap.

data.title: YouTube bans ‘medically unsubstantiated’ content from site
data.text: YouTube has started banning content that is in direct contradiction to the World Health Organization’s guidelines as the coronavirus pandemic continues to ravage the United States. The Google-owned company also announced that it will be removing conspiracy theory videos that say that COVID-19 is directly linked to 5G cell service.
